subject: History
title: The Bronze Age Collapse
description: A fast breakdown of The Bronze Age Collapse for builders.

hook.text: Around 1200 BC, every major civilization in the eastern Mediterranean collapsed within decades. Nobody fully knows why.

buildup.text: The Hittites, Mycenaeans, Egyptians, and Canaanites all fell or shrank dramatically in a single generation.

discovery.text: The mysterious Sea Peoples attacked coastal cities. Egyptian records describe massive battles against unknown invaders.

twist.text: Evidence suggests it wasn't just invadersâ€”drought, earthquakes, trade disruption, and revolt all hit at once.

climax.text: The collapse set civilization back centuries. It took 400 yearsâ€”the Dark Ages of antiquityâ€”before recovery began.

punchline.text: Everything broke at once and nobody could fix it.
